segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8

segments.pli: 8. Yamakavagga
segments.en: 8. Pairs

segments.pli: 73. Paṭhamamaraṇassatisutta
segments.en: 73. Mindfulness of Death (1st)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjakāvasathe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “bhikkhavo”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Venerable sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “maraṇassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā amatogadhā amatapariyosānā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of death is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial. It culminates in the deathless and ends with the deathless.

segments.pli: Bhāvetha no tumhe, bhikkhave, maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: But do you develop mindfulness of death?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahaṃ kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ rattindivaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day and night, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (1)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ divasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (2)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ upaḍḍhadivasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for half a day, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (3)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ ekapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (4)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ upaḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of alms-food, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (5)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ cattāro pañca ālope saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (6)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ ekaṃ ālopaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (7)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another mendicant said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “ahampi kho, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhāvesi maraṇassatin”ti?
segments.en: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

segments.pli: “Idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “In this case, sir, I think:

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ assasitvā vā passasāmi, passasitvā vā assasāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhāvemi maraṇassatin”ti. (8)
segments.en: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
segments.en: When this was said, the Buddha said to those mendicants:

segments.pli: “yvāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
segments.en: “The mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ rattindivaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: to live for a day and night …

segments.pli: Yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ divasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti;
segments.en: or to live for a day …

segments.pli: yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ upaḍḍhadivasaṃ jīveyyaṃ, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: or to live for half a day …

segments.pli: Yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ ekapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti;
segments.en: or to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food …

segments.pli: yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ upaḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: or to live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of alms-food …

segments.pli: Yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ cattāro pañca ālope saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti—
segments.en: or to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls …

segments.pli: ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, ‘bhikkhū pamattā viharanti, dandhaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāventi āsavānaṃ khayāya’.
segments.en: These are called mendicants who live negligently. They slackly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Yo ca khvāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
segments.en: But the mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ ekaṃ ālopaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
segments.en: to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful …

segments.pli: Yo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāveti:
‘aho vatāhaṃ tadantaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yadantaraṃ assasitvā vā passasāmi, passasitvā vā assasāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti—
segments.en: or to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out …

segments.pli: ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, ‘bhikkhū appamattā viharanti, tikkhaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāventi āsavānaṃ khayāya’.
segments.en: These are called mendicants who live diligently. They keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘appamattā viharissāma, tikkhaṃ maraṇassatiṃ bhāvayissāma āsavānaṃ khayāyā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will live diligently. We will keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.’

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika…

suttaplex.blurb: Various mendicants practice mindfulness of death, but do so inadequately. The Buddha explains how to do so with proper urgency,
